info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 1:02AM CDT until April 05 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LITTLE RIVER...NORTHWESTERN CASS...SOUTHEASTERN BOWIE...CENTRAL MORRIS AND SOUTHEASTERN TITUS COUNTIES... At 101 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mineral Springs to 7 miles east of Naples, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Ashdown, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Maud, Red Lick, Wilton, Ogden, Rocky Branch, Richmond, Leary, Douglassville, Marietta, Red Bank, Bryans Mill and Pine Prairie. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...and northeastern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
